paragraphs.content: Chapter 6
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 6

paragraphs.content: What shall we say then? Shall we continue in sin, that grace may abound?
paragraphs.contentHtml: What shall we say then? Shall we continue in sin, that grace may abound?

paragraphs.content: God forbid. How shall we, that are dead to sin, live any longer therein?
paragraphs.contentHtml: God forbid. How shall we, that are dead to sin, live any longer therein?

paragraphs.content: Know ye not, that so many of us as were baptized into Jesus Christ were baptized into his death?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Know ye not, that so many of us as were baptized into Jesus Christ were baptized into his death?

paragraphs.content: Therefore we are buried with him by baptism into death: that like as Christ was raised up from the dead by the glory of the Father, even so we also should walk in newness of life.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Therefore we are buried with him by baptism into death: that like as Christ was raised up from the dead by the glory of the Father, even so we also should walk in newness of life.

paragraphs.content: For if we have been planted together in the likeness of his death, we shall be also in the likeness of his resurrection:
paragraphs.contentHtml: For if we have been planted together in the likeness of his death, we shall be also in the likeness of his resurrection:

paragraphs.content: Knowing this, that our old man is crucified with him, that the body of sin might be destroyed, that henceforth we should not serve sin.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Knowing this, that our old man is crucified with him, that the body of sin might be destroyed, that henceforth we should not serve sin.

paragraphs.content: For he that is dead is freed from sin.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For he that is dead is freed from sin.

paragraphs.content: Now if we be dead with Christ, we believe that we shall also live with him:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Now if we be dead with Christ, we believe that we shall also live with him:

paragraphs.content: Knowing that Christ being raised from the dead dieth no more; death hath no more dominion over him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Knowing that Christ being raised from the dead dieth no more; death hath no more dominion over him.

paragraphs.content: For in that he died, he died unto sin once: but in that he liveth, he liveth unto God.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For in that he died, he died unto sin once: but in that he liveth, he liveth unto God.

paragraphs.content: Likewise reckon ye also yourselves to be dead indeed unto sin, but alive unto God through Jesus Christ our Lord.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Likewise reckon ye also yourselves to be dead indeed unto sin, but alive unto God through Jesus Christ our Lord.

paragraphs.content: Let not sin therefore reign in your mortal body, that ye should obey it in the lusts thereof.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let not sin therefore reign in your mortal body, that ye should obey it in the lusts thereof.

paragraphs.content: Neither yield ye your members as instruments of unrighteousness unto sin: but yield yourselves unto God, as those that are alive from the dead, and your members as instruments of righteousness unto God.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Neither yield ye your members as instruments of unrighteousness unto sin: but yield yourselves unto God, as those that are alive from the dead, and your members as instruments of righteousness unto God.

paragraphs.content: For sin shall not have dominion over you: for ye are not under the law, but under grace.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For sin shall not have dominion over you: for ye are not under the law, but under grace.

paragraphs.content: What then? shall we sin, because we are not under the law, but under grace? God forbid.
paragraphs.contentHtml: What then? shall we sin, because we are not under the law, but under grace? God forbid.

paragraphs.content: Know ye not, that to whom ye yield yourselves servants to obey, his servants ye are to whom ye obey; whether of sin unto death, or of obedience unto righteousness?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Know ye not, that to whom ye yield yourselves servants to obey, his servants ye are to whom ye obey; whether of sin unto death, or of obedience unto righteousness?

paragraphs.content: But God be thanked, that ye were the servants of sin, but ye have obeyed from the heart that form of doctrine which was delivered you.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But God be thanked, that ye were the servants of sin, but ye have obeyed from the heart that form of doctrine which was delivered you.

paragraphs.content: Being then made free from sin, ye became the servants of righteousness.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Being then made free from sin, ye became the servants of righteousness.

paragraphs.content: I speak after the manner of men because of the infirmity of your flesh: for as ye have yielded your members servants to uncleanness and to iniquity unto iniquity; even so now yield your members servants to righteousness unto holiness.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I speak after the manner of men because of the infirmity of your flesh: for as ye have yielded your members servants to uncleanness and to iniquity unto iniquity; even so now yield your members servants to righteousness unto holiness.

paragraphs.content: For when ye were the servants of sin, ye were free from righteousness.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For when ye were the servants of sin, ye were free from righteousness.

paragraphs.content: What fruit had ye then in those things whereof ye are now ashamed? for the end of those things is death.
paragraphs.contentHtml: What fruit had ye then in those things whereof ye are now ashamed? for the end of those things is death.

paragraphs.content: But now being made free from sin, and become servants to God, ye have your fruit unto holiness, and the end everlasting life.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But now being made free from sin, and become servants to God, ye have your fruit unto holiness, and the end everlasting life.

paragraphs.content: For the wages of sin is death; but the gift of God is eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For the wages of sin is death; but the gift of God is eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord.
